info.name: Banner
info.description:
In this section you can find information on how to create and manage various types of banners and all related objects. If the banner is hosted in Adform, the asset is created first which can be reused to create various banners. The created banners can then be used to create rotators or schedules for additional level of control or simply served through Direct or RTB.

Adform is also offering DCO (Dynamic Content Optimization) banners that are displaying different content depending on a predefined set of rules.

item.name: Ads Overview
item.description: This service returns banner information by ID or UUID.

request.description:
This method retrieves all banners under specified campaign.

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AdsOverview/Ads?campaignId=00000

This method retrieves banners by banner uuid or by AdId.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AdsOverview/Banners/00000
(00000 - Banner uuid or Ad ID)

This method retrieves rotators by AdId or uuid.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPlE: /api/v1/AdsOverview/Rotators/000000

This method retrieves shedules by AdId.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLES: /api/v1/AdsOverview/Schedules/000000

This method retrievesnested rotators by AdId.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

This method retrieves ads according to the search body in your request URL.

You need to define CampaignId in your request body.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.
This method retrieves members of an Ad(rotator, schedule, etc.) using it UUID

This method allows you to reset default banner attributes.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Advertisers/DefaultBannerAttributes/00000 (where 00000 is a ClientSiteId)

item.name: Get Default Banner Attributes for a Client Site

request.description:
This method allows you to get default bannetr attributes for a client site.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Advertisers/DefaultBannerAttributes/00000 (where 00000 is a ClientSiteId)

This method allows you to set new or update default banner attributes.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/Advertisers/DefaultBannerAttributes/00000 (where 00000 is a ClientSiteId)

item.name: Default Values
item.description: Banner Default Values service allows you to manage default values for banners. Default name format, default landing page, default banner attributes values, default backup image rule. Default values are stored in campaign level. Default values can be applied for multiple banners when uploading new or multi-editing the existing ones. Getting certain default value returns list of all possible values with default one marked as current.

request.description:
This method retrieves possible backup image determination rules with default marked.

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: v1/adsmanagement/BannerDefaultValues/00000/BackupImages
(00000 - CampaignId)

This method sets certain backup image recognition rules as default. 

You need to parse CampaignId and BackupImageId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /BannerDefaultValues/00000/BackupImages/1/Current
(00000 - CampaignId, 1 - BackupImageId)

This method sets default backup image recognition rules as none.

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXMAPLE: /adsmanagement/BannerDefaultValues/00000/BackupImages/Current
(00000 - CampaignId)

This method retrieves banner attributes with possible sub attributes with default marked. 

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /BannerDefaultValues/00000/BannerAttributes
(00000 - CampaignId)

This method sets certain banner attribute values as default.

You need to parse CampaignId, BannerAttributeId and BannerAttributeValueId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /BannerDefaultValues/00000/BannerAttributes/11111/Values/22222/Current
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - BannerAttributeId, 22222 - BannerAttributeValueId)

This method sets default banner attribute as none.

You need to parse CampaignId and BannerAttributeId on your request URL.

EXMAPLE: /adsmanagement/BannerDefaultValues/00000/BannerAttributes/111111/Values/Current
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - BannerAttributeId)

This method retrieves available landing pages with default marked. 

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLES: /adsmanagement/BannerDefaultValues/00000/LandingPages

This method sets certain landing page as default.

You need to parse CampaignId and LandingPageId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /BannerDefaultValues/00000/LandingPages/11111/Current
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - LandingPageId)

This method resert default landing page to none.

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /BannerDefaultValues/00000/LandingPages/Current
(00000 - CampaignId)

This method retrieves available banner name formats for the specified campaignwith default marked.

You need to parse CampaignId onyour request URL.

EXAMPLE: /BannerDefaultValues/00000/NameFormats
(00000 - CampaignId)

This method sets certain name format rule as defualt.

You need to parse CampaignId and NameFormatId on your request URL.

EXAPLE: /BannerDefaultValues/00000/NameFormats/4/Current
(00000 - CampaignId, 4 - NameFormatId)

item.name: Flash Banners
item.description: This service manages flash banners and their attributes.

request.description:
This method creates a new Flash banner.

You need to parse CampaignId in you request body.

Please note that FullFileName should also include file name extension. For example: Name.swf

This method retrieves a specific banner's uuid by internal Id.

You need to parse BannerId on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/uuid
(00000 - BannerId)

This method retrieves a specific banner by uuid.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method deletes a specific banner by uuid.

You need to parse BannerId on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000
(00000 - Banner uuid)

This method updates Flash banner asset file.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/File
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method renames an existing Flash banner.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/Title
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates Flash banner click url.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/ClickUrl
(00000 - banner uuid)

NOTE: You can add "CampaignClickUrlId" and specify already existing Campaign LandingPage. In such case you do not need to define full Click Url structure.

This method updates Flash banner attributes.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/Attributes
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method update flash banner settings.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/Settings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method clears banner content settings.

You need to parse BannerId on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/ContentSettings
(00000 - Banner uuid)

This method updates Flash banner content settings.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/ContentSettings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method removes Flash banner backup banner.

You need to parse BannerId on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/Backup
(00000 - Banner uuid)

This method assigns Flash banner backup.

You need to parse Flash banner uuid on you request URL.

Youneed to parse backup banner uuid in your request body.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/Backup
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates banner activation status (Active/not active).

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/FlashBanners/00000/Backup
(00000 - banner uuid)

item.name: Html Banners (From Assets)
item.description:
These services allow you to manage and create HTML banners. These services support the use and administration of creative-based banners like html, image or flash, as well as third party banners, links, rotators and video instreams. The banners can be uploaded directly or built from an existing asset while the banners themselves are sent as base64 strings. The banners are stored at campaign level and multiple tags can be created for them.

NOTE: After the banner is created the returned value refers to the operation but not the object itself.

NOTE: If you are constructing a banner from an asset, you need to upload an asset first or retrieve the existing asset's UUID. Please refer to Banner Asset Service for more information.

request.description:
This method creates HTML banners.

You need to define CampaignId, Html and backup asset uuids and ClickUrls in your request body.

This method deletes HTML banner.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method retrieves a HTML banner by uuid.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/HtmlBanners/00000
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method retrieves a HTML banner's uuid by internal Id.

You need to parse AdId on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/HtmlBanners/00000/uuid
(00000 - AdId)

This method updates HTML banner title.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/Title
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates HTML banner ClickUrls.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/ClickUrls
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates HTML banner Attributes.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/Attributes
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates HTML banner Settings.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/Settings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates HTML banner Content Settings.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/ContentSettings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method clears HTML banner content settings.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/ContentSettings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method asigns new asset to HTML banner.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/Asset
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates HTML banner activation status (active/not active).

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/HtmlBanners/00000/ActivationStatus
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method returns the object that was created and its information.

You need to parse correlationId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/OperationResults/00000

item.name: Interactive Instream
item.description: This service manages interactive instream banners and their attributes.

request.description:
This method creates new video banner.

CampaignId is required in you request body.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method retrieves a specific banner's uuid by internal Id.

BannerId is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/InteractiveInstream/00000/uuid
(00000 - BannerId)

This method retrieves a specific banner by uuid.

Banner uuid is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/InteractiveInstream/00000
(00000 - banner uuid)
This method retrieves default video settings of the Client that you are logged in.

This method deletes a specific banner by uuid.

Banner uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/InteractiveInstream/00000
(00000 - Banner uuid)

This method sets banner main asset file.

Banner uuid is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/InteractiveInstream/00000/OriginalVideoSource
(00000 - Banner uuid)

You need to indicate asset in your request body. Please choose either asset uuid OR asset ID.

This method sets banner additional asset file.

Banner uuid is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/InteractiveInstream/00000/AdditionalAssets
(00000 - banner uuid)

You need to indicate asset in your request body. Please choose either asset uuid OR asset ID.

This method renames an existing interactive video banner.

Banner uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/InteractiveVideo/00000/Title
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates banner attributes.

Banner uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/InteractiveInstream/00000/Attributes
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates banner ClickUrl.

Banner uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/LinkBanners/00000/ClickUrls
(00000 - banner uuid)

You can indicate already exsiting campaign landing page id as "CampaignClickUrlId" instead of filling full ClickUrl structure.

This method updates banner custom variables.

Banner uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/LinkBanners/00000/CustomVariables
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates banner video settings.

Banner uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/LinkBanners/00000/VideoSettings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates banner activation status (Active/not active).

Banner uuid is required on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/InteractiveVideo/00000/Backup
(00000 - banner uuid)

item.name: Native Ads (From Assets)
item.description:
These services allow you to manage and create Native Ads. 

NOTE: After the banner is created the returned value refers to the operation but not the object itself.

NOTE: If you are constructing a banner from an asset, you need to upload an asset first or retrieve the existing asset's UUID. Please refer to Banner Asset Service for more information.

request.description:
This method creates Native Ad.

You need to define CampaignId, Native Ad settings and ClickUrls in your request body.

This method deletes Native Ad.

You need to parse Ad uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/NativeAds/00000
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method retrieves a Native Ad by uuid.

You need to parse Ad uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/NativeAds/00000
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method retrieves a Native Ad uuid by internal Id.

You need to parse AdId on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/NativeAds/00000/uuid
(00000 - AdId)

This method updates Native Ad title.

You need to parse Ad uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/NativeAds/00000/Title
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates Native Ad ClickUrls.

You need to parse Ad uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/NativeAds/00000/ClickUrls
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates Native Ad Attributes.

You need to parse banner uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/NativeAds/00000/Attributes
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates Native Ad Settings.

You need to parse Ad uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/NativeAds/00000/Settings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method asigns new asset to a Native Ad.

You need to parse Ad uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/NativeAds/00000/Asset
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates Native Ad activation status (active/not active).

You need to parse Ad uuid on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/NativeAds/00000/ActivationStatus
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method returns the object that was created and its information.

You need to parse correlationId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/AssetBanners/OperationResults/00000

item.name: Operation Results
item.description: This service returns the object that was created and its information.

request.description:
This method returns results by CorrelationId which is generated in banner request responses.

Please note, that if operation results retrieves no content, it should be re-sent as this operation is asynchronious from other operations. Therefore, it may be in process of generating once it is requested.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/OperationResults/00000
(00000 - CorrelationId)

item.name: Packages
item.description: This service manages banner creation from packages.

request.description:
This method uploads a new banner package.

You need to parse CampaignId in you request body.

Please note that FullFileName should also include file name extension. For example: Name.zip

item.name: Upload new image or flash banners

request.description:
This method uploads new image or flash banners.

You need to parse CampaignId in you request body.

Please note that FullFileName should also include file name extension. For example: Name.png

This method allows you tto delete RMB content settings.

EXAMPLE: /RichMediaBanners/00000/ContentSettings
(where 00000 is your banner uuid)

This method allows you to get RMB content settings.

EXAMPLE: /RichMediaBanners/00000/ContentSettings
(where 00000 is your banner uuid)

This method allows you to update RMB content settings.

EXAMPLE: /RichMediaBanners/00000/ContentSettings
(where 00000 is your banner uuid)

item.name: Rotators
item.description: This service returns rotator and its members' information.

item.name: Rotator and its members IDs and uuids (by ID)

request.description:
This method gets rotator ands its' members IDs and uuids.

You need to parse banner ID on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/LinkBanners/00000/Title
(00000 - banner ID)

item.name: Rotator and its members IDs and uuids (by uuid)

request.description:
This method gets rotator ands its' members IDs and uuids.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/LinkBanners/00000/Title
(00000 - banner uuid)

item.name: Third Party Banners
item.description: This service manages Third Party Banners and their attributes.

request.description:
This method creates a new Third Party Banner.

CampaignId is required in your request body.

You can define ClickUrl by either specifying full link in "Url" field or choosing already existing campaign landing page and indicating its id in "CampaignClickUrlId" field.

This method retrieves a specific banner's uuid by internal Id.

BannerId is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000/uuid
(00000 - BannerId)

This method retrieves a specific banner by uuid.

Banner uuid is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method deletes a specific banner by uuid.

Banner uuid is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000
(00000 - Banner uuid)

This method revalidates banner content.

Banner uuid is required on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000/Content/Revalidation
(00000 - banner uuid)
This method allows you to parse banner script.

This method updates 3rd party banner content.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000/Content
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method renames an existing 3rd party banner.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000/Title
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates link banner click url.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000/ClickUrl
(00000 - banner uuid)

NOTE: You can add "CampaignClickUrlId" and specify already existing Campaign LandingPage. In such case you do not need to define full Click Url structure.

This method updates link banner attributes.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000/Attributes
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates link banner settings.

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/ThirdPartyBanners/00000/Settings
(00000 - banner uuid)

This method updates banner activation status (Active/not active).

You need to parse banner uuid on you request URL.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/LinkBanners/00000/Backup
(00000 - banner uuid)
